text: Malta at the Olympics is a history which began in 1928. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Malta was MAT. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-10-12. It is now MLT."Abbreviations, National Olympic Committees," 2009 Annual Report, p. 91 [PDF p. 92 of 94]; retrieved 2012-10-12. ==History== Teams from Malta have been in 18 Summer Olympic Games and 3 Winter Olympic Games. As of 2025 no Maltese athlete has won an Olympic medal. The Maltese Olympic Committee was formed in 1928 and recognized by the IOC in 1936. ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes ==References== Category:Nations at the Olympics Category:Sport in Malta
title: Malta at the Olympics
